intro: Hordeum spontaneum var. turcomanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan wild barley, is a wild grass species native to Central Asia. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along riverbanks. This variety is of interest to researchers due to its potential for genetic diversity and its role in agricultural breeding programs.
